I imagine I've re-invented the wheel here but here's how I made a gimbal:

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Ai_4AjH6Zhk?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

How... wait. You need to explain what you did there, I think.

EDIT:

Ahha. I see, you used the Klaw. Very nicely done, intriguing!
If the probe was on the engine pod, then it would be more gimbally...
Hahaha. Love it. Have a kerbal snack.
Excellent work! That looks magnificent- your next challenge will be to put that on a real spacefaring rocket!

I also made a two-claw version where I dropped one bit with a claw from above and then dropped that joined piece onto another claw below. That gave a gimbal with 90 deg of movement. But its a tad more complicated and I still haven't figured out what I'm going to do with the first one ![:sticktongue:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue2.gif).
